result.execSummary:
The defendant Jonathan R. Contreraz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver THC (>200-1000g), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(h)2.
  • Attempt Manufacture/Deliver Psilocin(<=100g), a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(g)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
On Counts #1 & #7, the Court sentences Mr. Contreraz to 3 and 1 half years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of 18 months, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 2 years, each count, consecutive. This sentence is to commence consecutive to any other previously imposed sentence

[MA]Case called at 10:43am
Defendant Jonathan R. Contreraz appears via video conferencing from KMCI, in custody. DA Susan Happ appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court verifies Defendant's name and date of birth

On Defendants Petition for Sentence Adjustment:
--The Court verifies review of complete file, petition and attachments, and Mr. Contreraz's letter
--Argument given by Mr. Contreraz
--Argument given by DA Happ
--Response given by Mr. Contreraz


The Court denies the Defendant's Petition for Sentence Adjustment, finds that it would not be in public interest. 

The Court finds that the video conferencing system is sight and sound sufficient.

--Take all prescribed medications as prescribed

[MK]] case called at 10:37am. 
Defendant Jonathan R. Contreraz in court with attorney David Zarwell.  DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin. 
This case was scheduled for hearing on the Defendant's Motion to Suppress today, however Attorney Zarwell submits paperwork for changes of plea and Attorney Zarwell confirms that the Defense is withdrawing the Motion to Suppress. 

DA Happ files an Amended Information that amends Count #7 to Attempted Manufacture of Psilocybin. 
Service of the Amended Information admitted; reading is waived.
The Court reviews the Modified Criminal Case Settlement form with Mr. Contreraz, verifying that Mr. Contreraz understands and joins in the agreement. 

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; pleas of " No Contest " entered on Counts #1 & #7; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts the plea, finds Mr. Contreraz guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.
On Motion of the State, the Court reads in and dismisses Counts #2, #3, #4, #5, #6.

On request of the Defense, the Court will schedule Sentencing on a later date.  
Attorney Zarwell indicates that at Sentencing the Defense will request a delay of the jail term start-date because Mr. Contreraz is taking an online college class and he is also pursuing obtaining drivers licence.  DA Happ indicates that the State will not oppose an additional delay on the commencement the jail term.
recess 10:51am.

NEXT:   Sentencing Hearing on 10/29/15 at 1:30pm

case called at 1:20-pm[MO]
Defendant Jonathan Contreraz appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, with Attorney Jeffrey De La Rosa (for bond purposes only).  Public Service Prosecuter Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin.  

On agreement of counsel, the Court finds that the videoconferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 

Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited. 
Preliminary Hearing time limits are waived by both parties.
Right to Counsel given; does not qualify for Public Defender appointment

The Court requires a $1,000  signature bond, with conditions:
--no acts or threats of violence
--no possession or ingestion of alcohol
--no presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores
--no possession or ingestion of controlled substances without a valid prescription
--no possession of drug paraphernalia
recess 1:37pm


NEXT: (1) Pretrial Conference on 3/4/15 9:20am    (2) Status Conference 4/7/15 at 9:00am
